    Example 1. Number

    CREATE (:Example {a: 1, b: 3.14})
    • The propertyÂ aÂ has the typeÂ integerÂ with the valueÂ 1.
    • The propertyÂ bÂ has the typeÂ floatÂ with the valueÂ 3.14.

    Example 2. String and boolean

    CREATE (:Example {c: 'This is an example string', d: true, e: false})
    • The propertyÂ cÂ has the typeÂ stringÂ with the valueÂ 'This is an example string'.
    • The propertyÂ dÂ has the typeÂ booleanÂ with the valueÂ true.
    • The propertyÂ eÂ has the typeÂ booleanÂ with the valueÂ false.

    Example 3. Lists

    CREATE (:Example {f: [1, 2, 3], g: [2.71, 3.14], h: ['abc', 'example'], i: [true, true, false]})
    • The propertyÂ fÂ contains an array with the valueÂ [1, 2, 3].
    • The propertyÂ gÂ contains an array with the valueÂ [2.71, 3.14].
    • The propertyÂ hÂ contains an array with the valueÂ ['abc', 'example'].
    • The propertyÂ iÂ contains an array with the valueÂ [true, true, false].
